definition: jurist/member of the pre-Han legalist school
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We caught up with a variety of lawyers and legal academics on the deal.
sentences.chinese: 我們就此協議聯繫了許多律師和法學家。

sentences.english: Whoever wishes to be a jurisconsult, let him continually study, and desire to be taught by every one.
sentences.chinese: 欲成爲法學家者，應不斷追求學問，並向一切人學習。

sentences.english: He was a very competent lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位很有才幹的法學家。

sentences.english: The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his own laurels .
sentences.chinese: 足智多謀的法學家已經想出了一個恢復名譽的計策。

sentences.english: Law Master basically fosters " jurisconsult " , it is academic research talent.
sentences.chinese: 法學碩士主要培養“法學家”，是學術研究型人才。

sentences.english: U. S. (Austrian-born) jurist and public official.
The Danish grammarian Jespersen first proposed the idea in 1886.
sentences.chinese: 最先由丹麥語法學家葉斯伯森於1886年提出。

definition: Joseph Needham (1900-1995), British biochemist and author of Science and Civilization in China
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
